Find all files containing a specific text (string) on Linux?
How do I find all files containing a specific string of text within their file contents?
The following doesn't work. It seems to display every single file in the system.
find / -type f -exec grep -H '...
qa_pairs.answer:
The following commands will search for the string "string_to_search" in all files in the current directory and its subdirectories.

Using grep:

grep -r "string_to_search" .

-r stands for recursive, meaning that the command will search in all subdirectories.
"." indicates the current directory.

Using find and grep:

find . -type f -exec grep "string_to_search" {} +
commands:
find and grep:

find . -type f -exec grep "string_to_search" {} +
 
grep -r "string_to_search" .
find . -type f -exec grep "string_to_search" {} +
